dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Fifty thousand dollars at Trump's Doonbeg resort since he left office—that's the figure from the Senate Ethics Committee.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifty thousand dollars at Trump's Doonbeg resort since he left office-that's the figure from the Senate Ethics Committee.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pentagon has spent at least $184,000if not moreat President Trumps Scottish resort since he took office, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and that includes about $25,000 tied to travel vouchers for military stopovers near Shannon Airport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and that includes about twenty five thousand dollars tied to travel vouchers for military stopovers near Shannon Airport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Defense Department records show that nearly $125,000 was spent at the Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland since August 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Pentagon's letter mentioned some of that spending might've gone toward renovations, which is uh, kind of interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the Pentagon's letter mentioned some of that spending might've gone toward renovations, which is uh, kind of interesting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There was also about $60,000 spent at the resort that could not be tied to actual travel vouchers, with the Pentagons letter suggesting that it could have been used on meals and restaurants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But honestly, it's way less than what a lot of people assumed was being spent there. The Republicans on the committee even acknowledged that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But honestly, it's way less than what a lot of people assumed was being spent there. The Republicans on the committee even acknowledged that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and it's not like this is new—Biden's been pretty careful about separating his business interests, unlike, you know…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and it's not like this is new-Biden's been pretty careful about separating his business interests, unlike, you know...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Unlike Trump, who still has his properties hosting all sorts of political figures. I mean, Forbes mentioned 20 members of Congress just in the last six months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unlike Trump, who still has his properties hosting all sorts of political figures. I mean, Forbes mentioned twenty members of Congress just in the last six months.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the last two years alone, at least 90 members of Congress, 250 administration officials and over 110 foreign officials from nearly 60 different countries have been seen at different Trump properties, according to a count by Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and foreign officials too. But here, it's mostly about military layovers, not exactly luxury political retreats.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and foreign officials too. But here, it's mostly about military layovers, not exactly luxury political retreats.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Various crews have been put up 30 miles away, at Trump Turnberry, during overnight stopovers, Politico first reported. In the last two years alone, at least 90 members of Congress, 250 administration officials and over 110 foreign officials from nearly 60 different countries have been seen at different Trump properties, according to a count by Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, you gotta wonder—even $50,000 is taxpayer money going to a resort owned by the former president's family.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, you gotta wonder-even fifty thousand dollars is taxpayer money going to a resort owned by the former president's family.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but at an average of $99 a night, it sounds more like practical lodging than some kind of profiteering scheme.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but at an average of ninety nine dollars a night, it sounds more like practical lodging than some kind of profiteering scheme.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At an average cost of $189 per night, that would suggest a total of 660 individual rooms paid for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the Senate committee seemed satisfied with the Pentagon's breakdown, so maybe it's not as controversial as it first sounded.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Senate committee seemed satisfied with the Pentagon's breakdown, so maybe it's not as controversial as it first sounded.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, though you know critics will still seize on anything with the name "Trump" attached to it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, though you know critics will still seize on anything with the name Trump attached to it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's just one of those things where perception and reality don't always line up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's just one of those things where perception and reality don't always line up.

HostB: But honestly, it’s way less than what a lot of people assumed was being spent there. The Republicans on the committee even acknowledged that.
HostA: Mhm, and it’s not like this is new—Biden’s been pretty careful about separating his business interests, unlike, you know…
HostB: Unlike Trump, who still has his properties hosting all sorts of political figures. I mean, Forbes mentioned 20 members of Congress just in the last six months.
HostA: Right, and foreign officials too. But here, it’s mostly about military layovers, not exactly luxury political retreats.
HostB: Still, you gotta wonder—even $50,000 is taxpayer money going to a resort owned by the former president’s family.
HostA: True, but at an average of $99 a night, it sounds more like practical lodging than some kind of profiteering scheme.
HostB: And the Senate committee seemed satisfied with the Pentagon’s breakdown, so maybe it’s not as controversial as it first sounded.
HostA: Yeah, though you know critics will still seize on anything with the name "Trump" attached to it.
